modules.description: This module provides operations to control media players via the MPRIS D-Bus interface, including quitting, raising, and adjusting fullscreen state. It works with `OBus_proxy.t` to interact with media player properties such as identity, desktop entry, supported URI schemes, and MIME types. Concrete use cases include integrating media player controls into desktop environments and querying player capabilities for playback management.

This module defines the MPRIS MediaPlayer2 interface with methods to control media players, including quitting and raising the player, and properties to query capabilities like fullscreen support, identity, and supported URI schemes. It works with D-Bus objects to expose media player functionality, enabling integration with desktop environments. Concrete use cases include implementing or interacting with media players that adhere to the MPRIS specification, such as handling playback controls or desktop entry integration.

This module provides playback control operations like play, pause, seek, and track navigation, alongside property accessors for monitoring playback state, volume, and metadata. It works with D-Bus-compatible types such as strings, integers, floats, and paths, integrating with media player objects exposed via the MPRIS D-Bus interface. It enables use cases like remote control of audio/video applications, dynamic UI updates in desktop environments, and metadata synchronization across media services.

This module defines methods, properties, and signals for managing playlists in a media player. It supports activating playlists, retrieving playlist metadata, and tracking active playlists and supported orderings. Concrete use cases include browsing, switching, and monitoring playlists in media applications.

This module enables control of media playback operations such as play, pause, seeking, and track navigation through D-Bus method calls on an `OBus_proxy.t` object. It provides access to player properties including playback status, loop mode, metadata (as key-value pairs), volume, and position (as `int64`), alongside capability flags like `can_play` and `can_seek` to determine supported features. These functions are used to implement media controllers, music streaming applications, or system-wide playback integrations that interact with MPRIS-compliant media players.

This module provides operations to manage and interact with media playlists over D-Bus, including activating playlists, retrieving playlist lists with sorting options, and monitoring playlist changes. It works with D-Bus proxies and handles playlist metadata such as identifiers, names, and descriptions. Concrete use cases include integrating with media players that expose the MPRIS D-Bus interface to control playlist playback and display playlist information.

This module implements D-Bus client operations for interacting with MPRIS-compliant media players, enabling control of player state, playback, and playlists. It operates on `OBus_proxy.t` objects to access and manipulate media player properties and methods, handling data types such as strings, integers, key-value metadata maps, and capability flags. Use cases include building media controllers, desktop environment integrations, and music streaming clients that remotely manage playback and playlist operations.

This module implements the MPRIS D-Bus interfaces for controlling media players and managing playlists. It provides methods and properties for playback control, player management, and playlist handling, working with D-Bus objects and basic types like strings, integers, and floats. Use cases include integrating media players with desktop environments, enabling remote control, and synchronizing media metadata and playlist state across applications.
